attributes.action: Legislate the unconditional wearing of face masks in retail outlets
attributes.additional_details:
The wearing of facemasks appears to have become optional in some quarters and this places staff and other service users at risk. The use of a lanyard is flawed as these can be purchased online. 
It is also the case that some people cannot be bothered to wear them. The staff of retail outlets are instructed not to challenge for fear of repercussions as they have no legislative back up.
attributes.background:
1) Introduce legislation that ensures all persons wear facemasks whilst in retail outlets including members of staff. 
2) Empower retail staff to challenge those refuse to wear a mask. 
3) Issue a certificate for those genuinely unwell who cannot wear a mask.

rejection.details:
It is already the law to wear a face covering in shops and shopping centres, we're therefore not exactly sure what further action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take. The Police are responsible for enforcing the law. 

You can find out more here:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own#when-to-wear-a-face-covering

You may wish to sign this petition: 

Make it an offence for shops to sell items to persons not wearing face coverings: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548576
